ARABIC: ٱلَّذِينَ ضَلَّ سَعْيُهُمْ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَهُمْ يَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُمْ يُحْسِنُونَ صُنْعًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: People whose efforts in the life of the dunya are misguided while they suppose that they are doing good.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Theirs whose effort is misspent in pursuit of the pleasures of the world, even though they think they are doing good things."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: It will be those whose effort went astray in the life of the world and who believe nevertheless that they are doing good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: It will be those who labor a great deal in this life but without guidance, yet think that they are doing a great many good deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Of those whose efforts are lost in (pursuit of) the life of this world, and they think that they are doing good deeds.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Those whose efforts have been wasted in this life while they thought that they were acquiring good by their deeds."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: (These are) they whose labor is lost in this world's life and they think that they are well versed in skill of the work of hands.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Those whose striving goes astray in the present life, while they think that they are working good deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Those whose effort goeth astray in the life of the world, and yet they reckon that they do good work.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They are those whose efforts have been wasted in the life of the world while they thought they were doing good.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They are those whose effort is wasted in the life of the world, and they deem that they are doing well in performance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Those whose efforts are misguided in the life of the world, while they suppose they are doing good.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Those whose efforts have been wasted in this life, while they thought that they were acquiring good by their works?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Those whose efforts have been wasted in this life while they thought that they were acquiring good by their deeds!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: (They are) those whose striving in this world go astray, while they think that what they are doing are good deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “Those whose efforts in this world are misguided, while they assume that they are doing well.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [They are] those whose effort is lost in worldly life, while they think that they are doing well in work."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [18:104]   Those whose effort goes astray in the life of this world, [those] whose deeds are invalid, while they reckon, they think, that they are doing good work, [good] deeds for which they will be rewarded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Those whose effort goeth astray) those whose works are thwarted (in the life of the world) these are the Kharijites; and it is also said that this refers to anchorites, (and yet they reckon that they do good work) and yet think that they are doing righteous works.
